Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is an assault on free speech.
The government should not determine what information citizens can access.
There is too much subjectivity in defining 'harm' and 'misinformation'.
The legislation could lead to censorship of opposing views.
Digital platforms may over-censor content to avoid fines.
Notable Quotes: How dare the Government, or its agency (ACMA) determine what information I am to be allowed to see?
The proposed Laws are an appalling assault on free speech in this country.
